text:
Sims Vista Market & Food Centre is one of these very traditional Food & Market Place , which is Quintessential Singapore as locals know & live it!

Plenty of choices of local varieties to suite everybody’s taste buds!

We managed to visit the Famous Sin-Kee chicken rice stall, but could have been enticed to visit many others, which we will do in The future!
I was informed through a mutual friend who loves her local food as much as I do that next trip to try the Green Chili Chicken Rice stall, run by a  Malay team! I promised to try it the next round when there! (The line as long as it was is always a good sign of it’s popularity)

A fairly clean place, with an offering that includes most local classics!

Attached some pictures of our recent visit!

# Sims Vista Market and Food Centre: A Singaporean Food Haven!

Located at 49 Sims Place, Singapore 380049, Sims Vista Market and Food Centre is a beloved institution among locals and foodies alike.

This vibrant food centre boasts an impressive array of stalls, each offering a unique culinary experience that showcases the diversity and richness of Singaporean cuisine.

From timeless classics to innovative creations, every dish is a testament to the skill and passion of the stallholders.

At Sims Vista Market and Food Centre, the atmosphere is lively, the food is delicious, and the prices are affordable. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this iconic food centre is a must-visit destination for anyone who loves Singaporean food.

# Rating: 5/5 stars
# Price Range: $5-$15 SGD per meal
# Recommended For: Foodies, locals, and anyone looking for an authentic Singaporean dining experience.
Great hawker centre for breakfast & lunch. Great value and some high quality food options.

There are a lot of delicious food here.
Food court seating is very spacious.

Normally I woulder order my usual

1) Soya bean /bean curd from a stall solely sell it.

2) Green chilli chicken rice

3) Duck rice.

A food centre catering mainly to the breakfast and lunch crowd. Been there a few times around 4pm and only a handful of stalls open. Heard the carrot cake is very good here but no chance to try it yet. Char kuay teow and Hokkien mee stall is open at 4pm though.
